text.author: MTSAMPLES.COM
text.title: HIV Followup
text.summary1: (human1) A physician report on examining a 41-year-old white male with HIV disease (stable control on Atripla), resolving left gluteal abscess, diabetes on oral therapy, hypertension, depression and chronic pain, and plans to continue medication (Gabapentin, Metformin, Glipizide, Atripla etc.) and psychological treatment, order lab work in 3-4 weeks and then see him a few weeks later.
text.summary2: (claude-3-5-sonnet-20241022; postedited) A 41-year-old male with controlled HIV, hypertension, newly diagnosed diabetes on oral therapy, and depression presents with improving left gluteal abscess post-I&D, showing CD4 count of 425 and viral load <50, but with blood pressure (145/90) and pulse (123).
text.summary3: (gpt4o) A 41-year-old male with stable HIV on Atripla, resolving left gluteal abscess on Flagyl, newly diagnosed diabetes on oral therapy, hypertension, depression, and unclear musculoskeletal pain is feeling better, advised to continue current medications, and follow up with labs in 3-4 weeks and his psychologist, with a physical exam showing minimal abnormalities.
text.summary4: (Meta-Llama-3-8B-Instruct) A 41-year-old man with HIV disease and stable control on Atripla is being managed for a resolving left gluteal abscess, newly diagnosed diabetes, hypertension, depression, and chronic musculoskeletal pain.
text.summary5: (Qwen2.5-3B-Instruct; postedited) A 41-year-old HIV patient with stable viral load, diabetes mellitus on oral therapy, hypertension, and depression reports resolving abscess, will see a psychologist and will have laboratory studies in 3-4 weeks.
